Definition.WordDefinition: rhenium Symbol: Re Atomic number: 75 Atomic weight: 186.2 Silvery-white metallic transition element. Obtained as a by-product of molybdenum refinement. Rhenium-molybdenum alloys are superconducting.
rhenium n : a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys; is obtained as a by-product in refining molybdenum [syn: {Re}, {atomic number 75}]
